pyneg.types package¶

Submodules¶

Message Types¶

A message type definitnion for easier checking and type annotations.

class pyneg.types.message_type.MessageType[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

EMPTY: No message, just a stub EXIT: sender is exiting the negotiation without agreement OFFER: A proposal with optionally a constraint ACCEPT: Agent has accepted the offer in this message

EMPTY = 1¶
EXIT = 2¶
OFFER = 3¶
ACCEPT = 4¶

Verbosity levels¶

Enum type for more understandable verbosity levels. hopefully quite self-describing.

class pyneg.types.verbosity.Verbosity[source]¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

None: No output. Messages: print each message as it is sent to another agent reasoning: Additionally print reasoning that led to the message debug: print absolutely everything.

none = 0¶
messages = 1¶
reasoning = 2¶
debug = 3¶

Module contents¶

This module defines constants and types used elsewhere. The Types are for type annotations only. Examples: >>> neg_space = {“First”:[“A”,”B”], “Second”:[“C”,”D”]} >>> nested = {“First”: {“A”:0, “B”:1}, “Second”:{“C”:1,”D”:0}} >>> atomic = {“First_A”:0, “First_B”:1, “Second_C”:1, “Second_D”:0}
